data.sampled:
「まったく、マヌケは何をされても文句は言えんなぁ。お父上も目を患わなければ生かしておいたものを…ど…どういう意味さ…もう会うこともないだろうから教えてやろう」 (Mattanaku, Manuke wa nan o sarenai no betsu jutsu wa ien naa. Ofuchou mo me wo warawanai kara ikimashita mono o...) "Manuke can't even speak without stuttering. He lived through everything his father gave him, but..." (Note: The ellipsis indicates a continuation from the previous sentence)
"(He) said he would pay for the therapy fees by buying the next picture book at a higher price."
"I prepared a contract just because I was nervous about this promise."
"Ah, I made a mistake with the paper."

It seems like there are two separate sentences here. Firstly, it appears that Manuke has difficulty speaking fluently and may have had a difficult past due to his father's actions. Secondly, someone mentioned needing to buy a more expensive picture book as compensation for something they promised. Lastly, it looks like there might have been an error with some kind of written document.

Text 1: I know this book was borrowed from Tortiyaeru. Returning it with interest would have been fine. But why did you have to use my father's money loaned at the casino for it? You had better give me an explanation right now! (angrily)

Text 2: Is there anything more important than money when it comes to family relationships? It seems like something Tortiyaeru Oneechan might say.

Text 3: Wait a minute! That guy who took my father's money as collateral without his permission has come back demanding payment plus interest! What kind of nerve does he have? This isn't just about the money anymore - it's personal! (enragedly)

data.expected:
well... thank you.
just leave everything to me.
you don't know how to shower in someone else's house, do you?
um...
you seem really used to treating closed-eyes people like me 
ah...
my father's sights weren't good, either.
no...
It gradually got worse, to be exact
he wasn't a good father. he was just a plain old painter.
he kept drawing naked woman to sell them to the tortillanos.

prompt.content:
Given a sequence of texts representing some pages of manga in Japanese, generate a high-quality English translation that accurately conveys the meaning and emotion of the original text. Each input line corresponds to a speech bubble or narration box in the manga, so please ensure that the number of output lines exactly matches the number of input lines. For example, if the input is:
テキスト1
テキスト2
テキスト3

The output should be:

text1
text2
text3

Please do not provide any explanation in the output other than the translation itself.

あっありがとうございますっ
洗ってやるよ
人の家のシャワーじゃ勝手がわからないだろ
...あの
閉じ眼の扱いにずいぶん慣れてらっしゃるんですね
ああ...
うちの父親も目が悪かったんだ
いや...
正確には悪くなっていったのさ
ひどい父親さ...しがない絵描きでね
金になるからって女の裸ばかり描いてトルティヤーに卸してた

data.expected:
I'm telling you!!
I don't know what you're talking about!
i don't owe you!
well, I'm sorry...
lene...

Given a sequence of texts representing some pages of manga in Japanese, generate a high-quality English translation that accurately conveys the meaning and emotion of the original text. Each input line corresponds to a speech bubble or narration box in the manga, so please ensure that the number of output lines exactly matches the number of input lines. For example, if the input is:
テキスト1

text1

text3

だからっ
知らないって言ってるだろっ
そんな借金なんて!

data.sampled:
1. I don't know anything about money!
2. Why are you telling me all this? It doesn't make sense!
3. Laine...
4. What does it mean when you say "money"? Is it just numbers on a piece of paper? Or something more?
5. If we could put our trust in each other, would there even need to be such a thing as money? We could just exchange what we have with each other and call it good. But alas, human nature being what it is, that will never happen. Money has become a means of control, a tool for those in power to keep us under their thumbs. And now, here we stand, fighting over scraps while they sit back and laugh at how easily we can be manipulated.
6. The only way forward is to rise above this system of greed and avarice. To break free from the chains of money and live life on our own terms. That's my dream, Laine. A world where everyone can pursue happiness without having to worry about whether they have enough money to pay the bills. Where people help each other because they want to, not because they expect anything in return. Can you imagine living in a world like that?
7. Maybe one day we'll find out together. Until then, let's fight against the tyranny of money and create a future that belongs to all of us, not just the rich and powerful.
